company.name: Aqua Finance, Inc.
company.business_description: Aqua Finance, Inc. underwrites, funds, services, and collects on credit agreements consumers use to fund the purchase of home water treatment systems. AFI extends credit through a network of water treatment dealers who offer its financing door-to-door across the United States.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 1601–1666j; and section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA), 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

complaint.factual_background: Aqua Finance Inc. (AFI) underwrites and funds consumer credit for water treatment systems sold door-to-door. AFI's dealers engage in widespread deceptive sales practices, misrepresenting financing terms to make them appear less costly than they actually are. AFI exacerbates these practices by requiring dealers to use contracts that fail to adequately disclose financing terms in violation of the FTC Act, TILA, and Regulation Z. AFI also knowingly reports inaccurate credit information to consumer reporting agencies and fails to maintain reasonable policies regarding the accuracy of furnished information in violation of the FCRA and Furnisher Rule.

representations_made.description: The interest rate and minimum monthly payment stay the same for the term of the financing
representations_made.quoted_text: the interest rate and minimum monthly payment stay the same for the term of the financing

representations_made.description: Accrual of interest on the financing is deferred for a certain period
representations_made.quoted_text: accrual of interest on the financing is deferred for a certain period

representations_made.description: A consumer who makes only the minimum monthly payments will repay the financing in six years or less
representations_made.quoted_text: a consumer who makes only the minimum monthly payments will repay the financing in six years or less

representations_made.description: Interest on the financing is included in the sales price
representations_made.quoted_text: interest on the financing is included in the sales price

representations_made.description: AFI is offering consumers financing to purchase water treatment systems
representations_made.quoted_text: AFI represents directly or indirectly, expressly or by implication, that it is offering consumers financing to purchase water treatment systems

counts.title: Misrepresentations - Terms of Financing
counts.representation: AFI represents that (a) the interest rate and minimum monthly payment stay the same for the term of the financing; (b) accrual of interest is deferred for a certain period; (c) consumers making only minimum monthly payments will repay the financing in six years or less; (d) the financing is interest-free; or (e) interest is included in the sales price
counts.fact: In fact, (a) the interest rate and minimum monthly payment increase after 12 months; (b) interest accrues immediately, not after a deferral period; (c) consumers making only minimum monthly payments will typically repay in nine to ten years, not six years or less; (d) the financing is not interest-free; and (e) interest is not included in the sales price
counts.conclusion: Therefore, Defendant's representations as set forth in Paragraph 94 are false or misleading and constitute a deceptive act or practice in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

counts.title: Failing to Adequately Disclose UCC Fixture Filing and Its Implications
counts.representation: AFI represents that it is offering consumers financing to purchase water treatment systems
counts.fact: AFI fails to disclose or disclose adequately that AFI's Credit Plan documents allow AFI to record a UCC fixture filing which, in many instances, has the practical effect of impeding the consumer's ability to sell or refinance their home. This fact would be material to consumers in deciding to finance a water treatment system
counts.conclusion: In light of the representations described in Paragraph 98, AFI's failure to disclose adequately the material information as set forth in Paragraph 97 constitutes a deceptive act or practice in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

counts.title: Unfairness - Underwriting Deceptively Marketed Credit
counts.representation: AFI has underwritten, serviced, and funded credit agreements that it knew or should have known were marketed through deceptive sales practices, including misrepresenting and failing to disclose the credit agreements' material terms and failing to monitor dealers' deceptive trade practices
counts.fact: AFI's acts or practices cause or are likely to cause substantial injury to consumers that consumers cannot reasonably avoid themselves and that is not outweighed by countervailing benefits to consumers or competition
counts.conclusion: Therefore, AFI's acts or practices as set forth in Paragraph 100 constitute unfair acts or practices in violation of Section 5 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), (n).

counts.title: Unfairness - Failing to Disclose Credit Terms
counts.representation: AFI has required dealers to use contracts that fail to disclose, or fail to disclose adequately, the: (a) prohibition on repeat purchases; (b) requirements for new credit applications to make repeat purchases; (c) APR; (d) finance charge; (e) total of payments; (f) number of payments; and (g) payment amount
counts.fact: AFI's acts or practices cause or are likely to cause substantial injury to consumers that consumers cannot reasonably avoid themselves and that is not outweighed by countervailing benefits to consumers or competition
counts.conclusion: Therefore, AFI's acts or practices as set forth in Paragraph 103 constitute unfair acts or practices in violation of Section 5 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), (n).

counts.title: Violations of TILA and Regulation Z
counts.representation: AFI extends closed-end credit to consumers but fails to clearly and conspicuously disclose in writing: (a) the identity of the creditor; (b) the amount financed; (c) the finance charge; (d) the annual percentage rate; (e) the payment schedule; and (f) the total of payments
counts.fact: AFI violates the requirements of TILA and Regulation Z by failing to clearly and conspicuously disclose in writing the required information so that the consumer can make an informed decision regarding the credit being offered
counts.conclusion: Therefore, AFI's practices set forth in Paragraph 113 of this Complaint violate Sections 121 and 128 of TILA, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1631 and 1638, and Sections 1026.17 and 1026.18 of Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. §§ 1026.17 and 1026.18.

counts.title: Lack of Reasonable Written Policies and Procedures
counts.representation: AFI has failed to: (a) establish and implement reasonable written policies and procedures regarding the accuracy and integrity of information it furnishes to CRAs; (b) consider and incorporate the appropriate guidelines set forth in Appendix E to 12 C.F.R. Part 1022; and (c) review such policies and procedures periodically and update them as necessary
counts.fact: AFI's failure to maintain reasonable policies and procedures violates the Furnisher Rule requirements designed to promote accuracy of information reported to consumer reporting agencies
counts.conclusion: By and through the acts and practices described in Paragraphs 63 through 71 and 86 through 90, AFI violates 12 C.F.R. §1022.42. Pursuant to Section 621(a)(1) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1), the acts and practices described in Paragraphs 63 through 71 and 86 through 90, also constitute unfair or deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

counts.title: Failing to Investigate and Report Results of Investigations
counts.representation: After receiving direct disputes, in numerous instances AFI has failed to complete its investigation of the dispute and report the results of the investigation to the consumer before the expiration of the period prescribed by Section 611(a)(1) of the FCRA
counts.fact: AFI documented receipt of direct disputes but never investigated or responded to consumers, failing to meet FCRA requirements for timely investigation and reporting
counts.conclusion: By and through the acts and practices described in Paragraphs 75 through 79, AFI violates Section 623(a)(8)(E)(iii) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s-2(a)(8)(iii), and 12 C.F.R. § 1022.43(e)(3). Pursuant to Section 621(a)(1) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1), the acts and practices described in Paragraphs 75 through 79 also constitute unfair or deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

counts.title: Failing to Notify CRAs of Disputed Information
counts.representation: In numerous instances in which consumers have informed AFI that they dispute the completeness or accuracy of information furnished by AFI to a CRA, AFI continues to furnish the information to CRAs without providing notice that such information is disputed by the consumer
counts.fact: AFI ignores most oral disputes and furnishes information to CRAs without notice that such information is disputed by the consumer, despite having a policy that required reporting all disputes
counts.conclusion: The acts and practices alleged in Paragraphs 80 through 82, violate Section 623(a)(3) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s-2(a)(3). Pursuant to Section 621(a)(1) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1), the acts and practices alleged in Paragraphs 80 through 82, also constitute unfair or deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

counts.title: Failing to Cease Furnishing Information After Receipt of Identity Theft Reports
counts.representation: In numerous instances, AFI has received identity theft reports from consumers relating to information AFI furnished concerning that consumer's account with AFI. AFI continues furnishing information about those accounts before investigating the accuracy of the information it was furnishing
counts.fact: AFI continued to furnish information that was the subject of identity theft reports without subsequently knowing it was correct, despite having a written policy stating it would not furnish such information
counts.conclusion: By and through the acts and practices described in Paragraphs 83 through 85, AFI violates § 623(a)(6)(B) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s-2(a)(6)(B). Pursuant to Section 621(a)(1) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1), the acts and practices described in Paragraphs 83 through 85 also constitute unfair or deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

counts.title: Knowingly Furnishing Inaccurate Information
counts.representation: AFI has furnished information relating to consumers to consumer reporting agencies while knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the information was inaccurate
counts.fact: AFI knowingly reported that consumers have revolving, or open-end credit, with available credit when these customers really have closed-end credit. AFI's credit department acknowledged it reports inaccurate information to CRAs
counts.conclusion: The acts and practices alleged in Paragraphs 72 through 74, violate Section 623 (a)(1)(A) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s-2(a)(1)(A). Pursuant to Section 621(a)(1) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)(1), the acts and practices alleged in Paragraphs 72 through 74, also constitute unfair or deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

definitions.Clear(ly) and conspicuous(ly): means that a required disclosure is difficult to miss (i.e., easily noticeable) and easily understandable by ordinary consumers, including in all of the following ways: 1. In any communication that is solely visual or solely audible, the disclosure must be made through the same means through which the communication is presented. In any communication made through both visual and audible means, such as a television advertisement, the disclosure must be presented simultaneously in both the visual and audible portions of the communication even if the representation requiring the disclosure is made in only one means. 2. A visual disclosure, by its size, contrast, location, the length of time it appears, and other characteristics, must stand out from any accompanying text or other visual elements so that it is easily noticed, read, and understood. 3. An audible disclosure, including by telephone or streaming video, must be delivered in a volume, speed, and cadence sufficient for ordinary consumers to easily hear and understand it. 4. In any communication using an interactive electronic medium, such as the Internet or software, the disclosure must be unavoidable. 5. The disclosure must use diction and syntax understandable to ordinary consumers and must appear in each language in which the representation that requires the disclosure appears. 6. The disclosure must comply with these requirements in each medium through which it is received, including all electronic devices and face-to-face communications. 7. The disclosure must not be contradicted or mitigated by, or inconsistent with, anything else in the communication. 8. When the representation or sales practice targets a specific audience, such as children, the elderly, or the terminally ill, "ordinary consumers" includes reasonable members of that group.
definitions.Compliance Date: means the later of March 30, 2024, or the date of entry of this Order.
definitions.Consumer Reporting Agency or CRA: means any Person which, for monetary fees, dues, or on a cooperative nonprofit basis, regularly engages in whole or in part in the practice of assembling or evaluating consumer credit information or other information on consumers for the purpose of furnishing consumer reports to third parties, and which uses any means or facility of interstate commerce for the purpose of preparing or furnishing consumer reports.
definitions.Covered Consumer Debt: means debt owed to Defendant by consumers who financed the purchase of water treatment equipment goods or services and that was identified in an email from counsel for Defendant to counsel for the Commission on October 12, 2023, whether the debt is possessed by Defendant or referred, sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to any collection agency or other party. This includes any outstanding principal balance and all unpaid interest and fees.
definitions.Credit Agreement(s): means any contract for consumers to finance the purchase of any water treatment good or service, including any modification or addendum to such a contract.
definitions.Dealer(s): means any Person engaged in the promotion, offering for sale, or sale of water treatment systems door-to-door.
definitions.Dealer Complaints: are written or verbal communications received by Defendant from consumers who have purchased water treatment system goods or services that communicate a suspicion or allegation of wrongful conduct, whether in the form of a misrepresentation by a Dealer or a Dealer's failure to disclose any material fact related to Credit Agreements or the financing of the purchase of any water treatment good or service, whether communicated to Defendant directly by the customer or through a third party.
definitions.Defendant: means Aqua Finance, Inc. and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Direct Dispute: means a dispute submitted directly to a Furnisher (including a Furnisher that is a debt collector) by a consumer concerning the accuracy of any information contained in a consumer report and pertaining to an account or other relationship that the Furnisher has or had with the consumer.
definitions.FCRA Qualified Direct Dispute: means a written Direct Dispute that is submitted by the consumer at the address provided by the Furnisher or, if the Furnisher has not specified an address, is submitted to any business address of the Furnisher and: (1) includes sufficient information to identify the account or other relationship that is in dispute; (2) includes the specific information the consumer is disputing and an explanation for the basis of the dispute; and (3) includes all supporting documentation or other information reasonably required by the Furnisher to substantiate the basis of the dispute.
definitions.Furnisher: means an entity that furnishes information relating to consumers to one or more Consumer Reporting Agencies for inclusion in a consumer report.
definitions.Identity Theft Report: means a report: i. that alleges identity theft with as much specificity as the consumer can provide; ii. that is a copy of an official, valid report filed by the consumer with a Federal, state, or local law enforcement agency, including the United States Postal Inspection Service, the filing of which subjects the Person filing the report to criminal penalties relating to the filing of false information, if, in fact, the information in the report is false; and iii. that may include additional information or documentation that a Furnisher or Consumer Reporting Agency reasonably requests for the purpose of determining the validity of the alleged identity theft, provided that the Furnisher or Consumer Reporting Agency: (A) makes such request not later than fifteen days after the date of receipt of the copy of the report form or the request by the consumer for the particular service, whichever shall be the later; (B) makes any supplemental requests for information or documentation and final determination on the acceptance of the Identity Theft Report within another fifteen days after its initial request for information or documentation; and (C) shall have five days to make a final determination on the acceptance of the Identity Theft Report, in the event that the Consumer Reporting Agency or Furnisher receives any such additional information or documentation on the eleventh day or later within the fifteen-day period set forth in (iii)(B) of this definition.
definitions.Person: means a natural person, organization, or other legal entity, including a corporation, partnership, proprietorship, association, cooperative, or any other group or combination acting as an entity.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from misrepresenting material terms of Credit Agreements, including interest rates, payment terms, and total costs.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent that interest rate stays the same for the term of the Credit Agreement
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendant, Defendant's officers, agents, employees, and attorneys and all others in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this Order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with promoting, offering, originating, servicing, collecting, or reporting on Credit Agreements, are hereby permanently restrained and enjoined from misrepresenting or assisting others, in misrepresenting, expressly or by implication: A. that interest rate stays the same for the term of the Credit Agreement

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent that the minimum monthly payment stays the same for the term of the Credit Agreement
requirements.quoted_text: permanently restrained and enjoined from misrepresenting or assisting others, in misrepresenting, expressly or by implication: B. that the minimum monthly payment stays the same for the term of the Credit Agreement

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent that accrual of interest on the Credit Agreement is deferred
requirements.quoted_text: permanently restrained and enjoined from misrepresenting or assisting others, in misrepresenting, expressly or by implication: C. that accrual of interest on the Credit Agreement is deferred

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent that the Credit Agreement will be repaid in a certain period of time if the consumer only makes the required minimum monthly payments
requirements.quoted_text: permanently restrained and enjoined from misrepresenting or assisting others, in misrepresenting, expressly or by implication: D. that the Credit Agreement will be repaid in a certain period of time if the consumer only makes the required minimum monthly payments

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent that the Credit Agreement is interest free
requirements.quoted_text: permanently restrained and enjoined from misrepresenting or assisting others, in misrepresenting, expressly or by implication: E. that the Credit Agreement is interest free

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent that interest on the Credit Agreement is included in the sales price
requirements.quoted_text: permanently restrained and enjoined from misrepresenting or assisting others, in misrepresenting, expressly or by implication: F. that interest on the Credit Agreement is included in the sales price

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent that any payments, rebates, or products will be provided as part of the Credit Agreement
requirements.quoted_text: permanently restrained and enjoined from misrepresenting or assisting others, in misrepresenting, expressly or by implication: G. that any payments, rebates, or products will be provided as part of the Credit Agreement

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent the material terms of any Credit Agreement, including the interest rate(s), annual percentage rate(s), finance charge(s), the minimum monthly payment amount(s), the amount financed, the payment schedule, whether any material term is subject to change, and the total costs
requirements.quoted_text: permanently restrained and enjoined from misrepresenting or assisting others, in misrepresenting, expressly or by implication: H. the material terms of any Credit Agreement, including: 1. the interest rate(s); 2. annual percentage rate(s); 3. finance charge(s); 4. the minimum monthly payment amount(s); 5. the amount financed; 6. the payment schedule; 7. whether any material term is subject to change; and 8. the total costs.

provisions.title: Monitoring of Dealers and Dealer Complaints
provisions.summary: Defendant must obtain written agreements from Dealers prohibiting misrepresentations, provide accurate financing information to Dealers, and implement a comprehensive Dealer complaint handling program including investigation and potential termination of problematic Dealers.

requirements.description: For new Dealers, obtain express written agreement that Dealer will not misrepresent financing terms, will comply with all laws, and will disclose financing terms
requirements.quoted_text: No later than the Compliance Date, for Dealers with whom the Defendant does not have, at the time of entry of this Order, an existing business relationship, before Defendant conducts any business with any such Dealer, obtain from each an express written agreement, which the Dealer must separately acknowledge apart from any other documentation Defendant may require the Dealer to sign, that it will not misrepresent any material aspect of the financing terms and conditions, will comply with all applicable laws in connection with the promotion or offering of financing, and disclose the financing terms outlined in Subsection C, unless inapplicable

requirements.description: For existing Dealers, obtain express written agreement at renewal or by Compliance Date that Dealer will not misrepresent financing terms, will comply with all laws, and will disclose financing terms
requirements.quoted_text: for Dealers with whom the Defendant does have, at the time of entry of this Order, an existing business relationship, at or before entering into a renewal of an agreement to continue the business relationship, or no later than the Compliance Date, obtain from each such Dealer an express written agreement, which the Dealer must separately acknowledge apart from any other documentation Defendant may require the Dealer to sign, that it will not misrepresent any material aspect of the financing terms and conditions, will comply with all applicable laws in connection with the promotion or offering of financing, and disclose the financing terms outlined in Subsection C, unless inapplicable

requirements.description: Provide each Dealer with accurate information related to financing on specified topics including APR, payment schedule, how interest accrues, available promotions, and repayment timeframes
requirements.quoted_text: no later than the Compliance Date, provide each Dealer with accurate information related to the financing of water treatment goods and services on the following topics to enable them to be able to explain to consumers: 1. the annual percentage rate and any scheduled changes to that rate; 2. the payment schedule; 3. how interest accrues; 4. the details of any available promotions; 5. to the extent known by Defendant prior to the consummation of the Credit Agreement: a. the initial amount financed; b. the total of payments for the initial amount financed or advanced; and c. how long it will take to repay the amount initially advanced if only the minimum monthly payments are made and no repeat or add on purchases are applied to the account

requirements.description: Document all verbal and written Dealer Complaints about Dealers in English or Spanish, including all additional details provided by consumers
requirements.quoted_text: implement a program that includes the following: 1. Dealer Complaint handling process a. document verbal and written Dealer Complaints about Dealers, whether received in English of Spanish, along with all additional details provided by consumers making such Dealer Complaints, and maintain all documents reflecting the foregoing consistent with the Section XI of this Order

requirements.description: For each new Dealer Complaint, if unable to determine complaint is without merit within 5 business days, provide Dealer with copy of written complaint or detailed summary of verbal complaint within 2 business days of that determination and request response within 10 business days
requirements.quoted_text: for each new Dealer Complaint received about Dealers with whom the Defendant has, at the time of the Dealer Complaint, an existing business relationship, if Defendant is not able to, within five business days of its receipt of a Dealer Complaint, determine based on the information available to Defendant that the Dealer Complaint is without merit, provide the Dealer with a copy of any written Dealer Complaint or a detailed summary of any verbal Dealer Complaint regarding such Dealer, within two business days of Defendant making that determination and request a response from the Dealer within 10 business days of the date of Defendant's transmission of the Dealer Complaint to the Dealer

requirements.description: For each new Dealer Complaint, conduct reasonable investigation and document details and findings within 10 business days of the Dealer response due date
requirements.quoted_text: for each new Dealer Complaint, conduct a reasonable investigation and document the details and findings of each such investigation, including any response from the Dealer received in response to a request pursuant to Subsection D.1.b, within 10 business days of the Dealer response due date

requirements.description: If Dealer reasonably believed to have misrepresented facts or failed to disclose required information, provide detailed notice to Dealer within 5 business days of concluding investigation, and require Dealer to provide evidence within 10 business days that no violations occurred or that practices ceased and remedial action taken
requirements.quoted_text: for any Dealer that Defendant, after conducting such investigation, reasonably believes has misrepresented any fact identified in Section I of this Order, or failed to disclose the information identified in Section II.C of this Order unless inapplicable, (1) provide detailed notice of Defendant's findings to that Dealer within five business days of concluding the investigation, and (2) require that the Dealer, within 10 business days after Defendant's provision of such notice, provide evidence either (i) that there were no misrepresentations of any fact outlined in Section I of this Order, or failure to disclose the information outlined in Section II.C of this Order, or (ii) that any such practices have ceased and that such Dealer has taken appropriate remedial action to cure any identified harm caused to the consumer and to prevent future misrepresentations or failures to disclose

requirements.description: If Dealer engaged in pattern of misrepresentations or failures to disclose, permanently terminate business relationship with that Dealer within 30 days
requirements.quoted_text: if following Defendant's investigations of complaints against a Dealer, Defendant determines that Dealer engaged in a pattern of (i) misrepresentations of any fact outlined in Section I of this Order, or (ii) failures to disclose the information outlined in Section II.C of this Order unless inapplicable, Defendant must permanently terminate, within 30 days, its business relationship with that Dealer

requirements.description: For any terminated Dealer, also terminate business relationship with any owners and operators of that Dealer known to have engaged in prohibited activities within 30 days
requirements.quoted_text: for any Dealer that Defendant terminates, Defendant must also terminate its business relationship with any owners and operators of that Dealer within 30 days, to the extent any such owner or operator is known by Defendant to have engaged in the activities prohibited by this Order

provisions.title: Required Disclosures
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide clear and conspicuous written disclosures of material credit terms before consumers sign Credit Agreements and must comply with Truth in Lending Act and Regulation Z.

requirements.description: Prior to entering closed-end or open-end Credit Agreements, disclose in writing, clearly and conspicuously, before consumer signs, specified information including creditor identity, APR, amount financed, finance charge, payment schedule, total payments, UCC security interest information, and impact on property sale or refinancing
requirements.quoted_text: beginning no later than the Compliance Date, prior to entering an agreement for closed-end Credit Agreements, and before the first transaction is made under open-end Credit Agreements, failing to disclose in writing (electronic or hardcopy), Clearly and Conspicuously, and in a form that the consumer may keep, before the consumer signs the Credit Agreement, the following information in a manner reflecting the terms of the legal obligation between the parties: 1. the identity of the creditor; 2. the annual percentage rate; 3. for closed-end Credit Agreements a. the amount financed; b. the finance charge; c. the payment schedule for the amount financed; and d. the total number of payments; 4. for open-end Credit Agreements a. the amount financed for the first transaction; b. the finance charge on the first transaction; c. the payment schedule for the amount financed for the first transaction; and d. the total number of payments on the first transaction if the minimum monthly payment is paid each month; 5. that the creditor, or any party that subsequently assumes the Credit Agreement, can record a purchase money security interest under the Uniform Commercial Code ("UCC") in the product being financed, when such is true; and 6. that the consumer's ability to sell or refinance their property where the water treatment system is installed may be affected by such a UCC filing.

requirements.description: Must not violate any provision of the Truth in Lending Act or Regulation Z
requirements.quoted_text: violating any provision of the Truth in Lending Act, 15 U.S.C. §§1601-1666j, or Regulation Z, 12 C.F.R. Part 1026.

provisions.title: Prohibited Credit Reporting Activities
provisions.summary: Defendant must comply with FCRA and Furnisher Rule requirements, including establishing written policies and procedures for accuracy and integrity of information furnished to credit reporting agencies and conducting reasonable investigations of consumer disputes.

requirements.description: Establish and implement reasonable written policies and procedures regarding accuracy and integrity of information furnished to CRAs, appropriate to the nature, size, complexity, and scope of Defendant's activities
requirements.quoted_text: failing to comply with 12 C.F.R. § 1022.42, a copy of which is attached as Attachment A, including by failing to: 1. establish and implement reasonable written policies and procedures regarding the accuracy and integrity of the information relating to consumers that it furnishes to CRAs that are appropriate to the nature, size, complexity, and scope of Defendant's activities

requirements.description: Consider the guidelines set forth in Appendix E to 12 C.F.R. Part 1022 in developing policies and procedures, and incorporate those guidelines that are appropriate
requirements.quoted_text: failing to comply with 12 C.F.R. § 1022.42, a copy of which is attached as Attachment A, including by failing to: 2. consider the guidelines set forth in Appendix E to 12 C.F.R. Part 1022, a copy of which is attached as Attachment B, in developing the policies and procedures, and incorporate those guidelines that are appropriate

requirements.description: Periodically review written policies and procedures and update them as necessary to ensure their continued effectiveness
requirements.quoted_text: failing to comply with 12 C.F.R. § 1022.42, a copy of which is attached as Attachment A, including by failing to: 3. periodically review the written policies and procedures and update them as necessary to ensure their continued effectiveness

requirements.description: Establish and implement reasonable written policies and procedures regarding reasonable investigations of FCRA Qualified Direct Disputes, regardless of the language
requirements.quoted_text: failing to: 1. establish and implement reasonable written policies and procedures regarding reasonable investigations of FCRA Qualified Direct Disputes, regardless of the language

requirements.description: In developing policies and procedures concerning FCRA Qualified Direct Disputes, incorporate provisions for employee training, document retention, employee action documentation, and auditing programs
requirements.quoted_text: failing to: 2. in developing the policies and procedures concerning FCRA Qualified Direct Disputes, regardless of language, incorporate reasonable provisions related to: (a)training employees whose duties include processing, responding to, or investigating Direct Disputes, including training on the requirements of the FCRA and related regulations; (b) retaining documents related to FCRA Qualified Direct Disputes for a reasonable period of time to allow for effective training and auditing; (c) requiring employees to document actions taken in processing, responding to, or investigating FCRA Qualified Direct Disputes, to allow for effective training and auditing; and (d) establishing an auditing program and schedule that is reasonably designed to promote compliance with the requirements of the FCRA and related regulations

requirements.description: Periodically review written policies and procedures regarding conduct of reasonable investigations of FCRA Qualified Direct Disputes and update them as necessary
requirements.quoted_text: failing to: 3. periodically review the written policies and procedures regarding the conduct of reasonable investigations of FCRA Qualified Direct Disputes and update them as necessary to ensure their continued effectiveness

requirements.description: Upon receiving an FCRA Qualified Direct Dispute, conduct a reasonable investigation with respect to the disputed information
requirements.quoted_text: failing to comply with 12 C.F.R. § 1022.43, a copy of which is attached as Attachment C, including by, upon receiving an FCRA Qualified Direct Dispute, failing to: 1. conduct a reasonable investigation with respect to the disputed information

requirements.description: Review all relevant information provided by the consumer with the dispute notice
requirements.quoted_text: failing to comply with 12 C.F.R. § 1022.43, a copy of which is attached as Attachment C, including by, upon receiving an FCRA Qualified Direct Dispute, failing to: 2. review all relevant information provided by the consumer with the dispute notice

requirements.description: Complete investigation of dispute and report results to consumer before expiration of period prescribed by Section 611(a)(1) of the FCRA
requirements.quoted_text: failing to comply with 12 C.F.R. § 1022.43, a copy of which is attached as Attachment C, including by, upon receiving an FCRA Qualified Direct Dispute, failing to: 3. complete its investigation of the dispute and report the results of the investigation to the consumer before the expiration of the period prescribed by Section 611(a)(1) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C 1681i(a)(1), a copy of which is attached as Attachment D

requirements.description: Cease furnishing information known or reasonably believed to be inaccurate, as required by Section 623 (a)(1)(A) of the FCRA
requirements.quoted_text: failing to comply with Section 623 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s-2, a copy of which is attached as Attachment E, including by failing to: 1. cease furnishing information it knows or has reasonable cause to believe is inaccurate, as required by Section 623 (a)(1)(A) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s-2(a)(1)(A), notwithstanding any alternative compliance methods that may be generally available under Section 623(a)(1)(C) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. §1681s-2(a)(1)(C)

requirements.description: Report information as 'disputed' to CRAs when consumers dispute, including verbally, the completeness or accuracy of any information furnished to a CRA
requirements.quoted_text: failing to comply with Section 623 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s-2, a copy of which is attached as Attachment E, including by failing to: 2. report information as "disputed" to CRAs when consumers dispute, including verbally, the completeness or accuracy of any information Defendant furnished to a CRA, as required by Section 623(a)(3) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s-2(a)(3)

requirements.description: Cease furnishing information that purports to relate to a consumer to any CRA upon receipt of an Identity Theft Report at the address specified by Defendant, unless and until Defendant subsequently knows or is informed by the consumer that the information is correct
requirements.quoted_text: failing to comply with Section 623 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s-2, a copy of which is attached as Attachment E, including by failing to: 3. cease furnishing information that purports to relate to a consumer to any CRA upon receipt by Defendant of an Identity Theft Report at the address specified by Defendant for receiving such reports, unless and until Defendant subsequently knows or is informed by the consumer that the information being furnished is correct, as required by Section 623(a)(6)(B) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s-2(a)(6)(B).

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment
provisions.summary: Judgment of $43,605,980 entered against Defendant, consisting of $20 million payment to FTC and cessation of collection on minimum $23,605,980 in Covered Consumer Debt, including debt recall, credit reporting deletion, UCC filing termination, and refunds.

requirements.description: Pay $20,000,000 to the Commission by electronic fund transfer
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant is ordered to pay to the Commission Twenty Million Dollars ($20,000,000), which, as Defendant stipulates, its undersigned counsel holds in escrow for no purpose other than payment to the Commission. Such payment must be made within 7 days of entry of this Order by electronic fund transfer in accordance with instructions previously provided by a representative of the Commission.

requirements.description: Cease collecting on all Covered Consumer Debt and notify any collection agency or other third party collecting Covered Consumer Debt to cease such collection efforts
requirements.quoted_text: Within 10 business days after entry of this Order, Defendant shall cease collecting on all Covered Consumer Debt and notify any collection agency or other third party collecting Covered Consumer Debt to cease such collection efforts.

requirements.description: Recall, purchase, or otherwise obtain any Covered Consumer Debt that Defendant has referred, sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to any collection agency or other third party
requirements.quoted_text: Within 60 business days after entry of this Order, Defendant shall recall, purchase, or otherwise obtain any Covered Consumer Debt that Defendant has referred, sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to any collection agency or other third party.

requirements.description: Request that each CRA delete the Covered Consumer Debt from the consumer's credit reporting file
requirements.quoted_text: For any Covered Consumer Debt that has been reported to a CRA, Defendant shall, within 30 business days of entry of this Order, request that each CRA delete the Covered Consumer Debt from the consumer's credit reporting file.

requirements.description: File termination statement with the recorder's office where each fixture filing for water treatment equipment is recorded
requirements.quoted_text: For any consumer with Covered Consumer Debt for which Defendant has recorded, or caused to be recorded, a Uniform Commercial Code fixture filing for associated water treatment equipment goods or services, Defendant shall cause to be filed, within 30 business days of entry of this order, a termination statement with the recorder's office where each fixture filing for water treatment equipment is recorded.

requirements.description: Take additional action as necessary to effectuate termination of UCC fixture filings if informed that additional action is needed
requirements.quoted_text: To the extent that Defendant is informed that any additional action is necessary to effectuate the termination of all such fixture filings, including but not limited to additional information requested by the agency with which the termination statement has been filed, Defendant will take such additional action as necessary and as soon as practicable but within 14 business days of learning that additional action is necessary.

requirements.description: Provide the Commission with a list of all consumers whose fixture filing has been terminated
requirements.quoted_text: Within 10 business days of filing these termination statements, Defendant shall provide the Commission with a list of all consumers whose fixture filing it has terminated.

requirements.description: Refund any payments received for Covered Consumer Debt after the effective date of this Order
requirements.quoted_text: To the extent Defendant receives any payments for Covered Consumer Debt after the effective date of this Order, Defendant shall, within 30 days of receipt, refund any such payments.

requirements.description: Provide signed declaration to Commission attesting that it has ceased collecting on all Covered Consumer Debt
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant shall, within 90 business days after entry of this Order, provide a signed declaration to the Commission attesting that it has ceased collecting on all Covered Consumer Debt as required by Section V.A.2.

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all rights to assets transferred pursuant to the Order, facts in Complaint taken as true for future litigation, and payment delinquencies may be reported using Taxpayer Identification Numbers.

requirements.description: Defendant relinquishes dominion and all legal and equitable right, title, and interest in any assets transferred pursuant to this Order
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant relinquishes dominion and all legal and equitable right, title, and interest in any assets transferred pursuant to this Order and may not seek the return of any assets.

provisions.title: Consumer Notification
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide notification in English and Spanish to each consumer with Covered Consumer Debt using prescribed text, and report notification details to the Commission.

requirements.description: Provide notification to each consumer with Covered Consumer Debt, using the notification in both English and Spanish provided as Attachment F, by electronic mail and by written notice sent to the most recent address
requirements.quoted_text: Within 15 business days of entry of this Order, provide notification to each consumer with Covered Consumer Debt, using the notification, in both English and Spanish, provided as Attachment F to this Order. Notification shall be given: 1. By electronic mail to the most recent electronic mail address of the consumer known to the Defendant, if any; and 2. By written notice sent to the most recent address of the consumer known to the Defendant.

requirements.description: Provide the Commission with signed declaration identifying the name of each consumer required to be notified, including mailing address, email address, telephone number, method of notification, and whether any notice was returned undelivered
requirements.quoted_text: Provide the Commission, within 10 business days after providing consumer notice pursuant to Subsection A., with a signed declaration identifying the name of each consumer required to be notified, including, to the extent known: (i) mailing address; (ii) email address; (iii)telephone number; (iv) the method or methods of notification; and (v) whether any electronic mail or written notice was returned undelivered.

provisions.title: Customer Information
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide customer information to enable Commission to administer consumer redress and is prohibited from disclosing, using, or benefitting from customer information obtained in connection with extension of consumer credit.

requirements.description: Provide sufficient customer information to enable the Commission to efficiently administer consumer redress; if Commission requests redress information in writing, provide it in prescribed form within 14 days
requirements.quoted_text: Failing to provide sufficient customer information to enable the Commission to efficiently administer consumer redress. Defendant represents that it has provided this redress information to the Commission. If a representative of the Commission requests in writing any information related to redress, Defendant must provide it, in the form prescribed by the Commission, within 14 days.

requirements.description: Must not disclose, use, or benefit from customer information obtained prior to entry of Order in connection with extension of consumer credit, except as required by law or court order
requirements.quoted_text: Disclosing, using, or benefitting from customer information, including the name, address, telephone number, email address, social security number, other identifying information, or any data that enables access to a customer's account (including a credit card, bank account, or other financial account), that Defendant obtained prior to entry of this Order in connection with the extension of consumer credit. Provided, however, that customer information need not be disposed of, and may be disclosed, to the extent requested by a government agency or required by law, regulation, or court order.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit acknowledgment of receipt of Order and deliver copies to principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, representatives, and Dealers, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each.

requirements.description: Submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order sworn under penalty of perjury
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant, within 7 days of entry of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order sworn under penalty of perjury.

requirements.description: Deliver copy of Order to all principals, officers, directors, LLC managers and members, employees with managerial responsibilities, agents, representatives, and Dealers who participate in conduct related to subject matter of Order, and to any business entity resulting from change in structure
requirements.quoted_text: For 5 years after entry of this Order, Defendant must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees having managerial responsibilities for conduct related to the subject matter of the Order and all agents, representatives and Dealers who participate in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Section titled Compliance Reporting. Delivery must occur within 7 days of entry of this Order for current personnel, agents, representatives, and Dealers. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.

requirements.description: Obtain signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of Order from each individual or entity to which Defendant delivered a copy of Order
requirements.quoted_text: From each individual or entity to which a Defendant delivered a copy of this Order, that Defendant must obtain, within 30 days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit compliance reports to the Commission one year after entry of Order and provide compliance notices within 14 days of specified changes for 10 years.

requirements.description: Submit annual compliance report sworn under penalty of perjury identifying contact information, business details, activities, compliance with each Section, and copies of Order Acknowledgments
requirements.quoted_text: One year after entry of this Order, Defendant must submit a compliance report, swornunder penalty of perjury, Defendant must: (1) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission may use to communicate with Defendant; (2) identify all of the Defendant's businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (3) describe the activities of each business, including the goods, services, or credit or loan products offered, the means of advertising, marketing, and sales; (4) describe in detail whether and how that Defendant is in compliance with each Section of this Order; and (5) provide a copy of each Order Acknowledgment obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Submit compliance notice sworn under penalty of perjury within 14 days of any change in designated point of contact or structure of Defendant or any entity that Defendant has ownership interest in or controls
requirements.quoted_text: For 10 years after entry of this Order, Defendant must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within 14 days of any change in the following, Defendant must report any change in: (1) any designated point of contact; or (2) the structure of Defendant or any entity that Defendant has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Submit notice to Commission of filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Defendant
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant must submit to the Commission notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against such Defendant within 14 days of its filing.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create certain records for 10 years after entry of Order and retain each such record for 5 years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, Dealer complaint records, compliance records, and marketing materials.

requirements.description: Create and retain accounting records showing revenues from all Credit Agreements
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant must create certain records for 10 years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for 5 years. Specifically, Defendant must create and retain the following records: A. accounting records showing the revenues from all Credit Agreements

requirements.description: Create and retain personnel records showing name, addresses, telephone numbers, job title or position, dates of service, and reason for termination for each person providing services
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant must create certain records for 10 years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for 5 years. Specifically, Defendant must create and retain the following records: B. personnel records showing, for each person providing services, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person's: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination

requirements.description: Create and retain records of all consumer complaints concerning the subject matter of this Order
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant must create certain records for 10 years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for 5 years. Specifically, Defendant must create and retain the following records: C. records of all consumer complaints concerning the subject matter of this Order

requirements.description: Create and retain all records relating to Monitoring of Dealer Complaints
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant must create certain records for 10 years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for 5 years. Specifically, Defendant must create and retain the following records: D. all records relating to the Section titled Monitoring of Dealer Complaints

requirements.description: Create and retain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant must create certain records for 10 years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for 5 years. Specifically, Defendant must create and retain the following records: E. all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission

requirements.description: Create and retain a copy of each unique advertisement or other marketing material
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant must create certain records for 10 years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for 5 years. Specifically, Defendant must create and retain the following records: F. a copy of each unique advertisement or other marketing material.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: Commission is authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through document requests, depositions, employee interviews, and other lawful means including posing as consumers.

requirements.description: Within 14 days of written request from Commission representative, submit additional compliance reports or requested information sworn under penalty of perjury, appear for depositions, and produce documents for inspection and copying
requirements.quoted_text: Within 14 days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, Defendant must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury; appear for depositions; and produce documents for inspection and copying. The Commission is also authorized to obtain discovery, without further leave of court, using any of the procedures prescribed by Federal Rules of Civil Procedure 29, 30 (including telephonic depositions), 31, 33, 34, 36, 45, and 69.

requirements.description: Permit Commission representatives to interview any employee or other person affiliated with Defendant who has agreed to such an interview
requirements.quoted_text: For matters concerning this Order, the Commission is authorized to communicate directly with Defendant. Defendant must permit representatives of the Commission to interview any employee or other person affiliated with Defendant who has agreed to such an interview. The person interviewed may have counsel present.

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.

requirements.description: Court retains jurisdiction for construction, modification, and enforcement of Order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.

duration.termination_text: This Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
